intro: Bartsia similis, commonly known as the similar bartsia, is a herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of southern and eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its lack of true roots. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It features small, opposite leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Bartsia similis is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora and is relatively uncommon in the wild.
